author: MarketBeat
title: Jefferies Financial Group Issues Pessimistic Forecast for Hafnia (NYSE:HAFN) Stock Price
text:
Jefferies Financial Group Issues Pessimistic Forecast for Hafnia (NYSE:HAFN) Stock Price Written by MarketBeat December 17, 2024 Share Link copied to clipboard. Hafnia ( NYSE:HAFN - Get Free Report ) had its price objective reduced by investment analysts at Jefferies Financial Group from $8.00 to $6.50 in a report issued on Tuesday, Benzinga reports. The firm currently has a "buy" rating on the stock. Jefferies Financial Group's price target would indicate a potential upside of 23.69% from the stock's current price. Get Hafnia alerts: Sign Up Hafnia Stock Down 3.0 % Top Shipping Firms Driving Industry-Leading Revenue Growth
HAFN stock opened at $5.26 on Tuesday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.34, a current ratio of 1.70 and a quick ratio of 1.52. The firm has a market capitalization of $2.66 billion and a P/E ratio of 3.09. Hafnia has a 52-week low of $5.13 and a 52-week high of $8.99. The company's 50 day simple moving average is $5.89 and its 200-day simple moving average is $7.10. Institutional Investors Weigh In On Hafnia
Large investors have recently made changes to their positions in the company. Bank of New York Mellon Corp acquired a new position in shares of Hafnia during the 2nd quarter valued at about $2,421,000. Allspring Global Investments Holdings LLC acquired a new stake in shares of Hafnia in the second quarter worth $60,000. Zurcher Kantonalbank Zurich Cantonalbank bought a new stake in shares of Hafnia during the 2nd quarter worth $528,000. TD Asset Management Inc bought a new position in Hafnia in the 2nd quarter worth $148,000. Finally, Acadian Asset Management LLC acquired a new position in Hafnia during the 2nd quarter worth $107,651,000. Hafnia Company Profile ( Get Free Report )
Hafnia Limited owns and operates oil product tankers in Bermuda. It operates through Long Range II, Long Range I, Medium Range (MR), Handy size, and Specialized segments. The company transports clean and dirty, refined oil products, vegetable oil, and easy chemicals to national and international oil companies, and chemical companies, as well as trading and utility companies; and owns and operates 200 vessels.
